page.title: 01BELLSHILL AND MOSSEND
page.content: Bellshill grew up round a Relief Church (now St Andrew's Church of Scotland) and a group of cottages built on a headland on the Glasgow to Edinburgh Road where it was crossed by a North to south Road.This growth was a result of the Industrial Revolution with the discovery of iron and coal in the area. Old Bellshill and Mossend housing consisted of Tenement flats and miners' rows now replaced by modern housing built by the District Council and The Scottish Special Housing Association and a few private developers in more recent times. With the loss of the heavy industries there has been a rise in the level of unemployment alleviated by the creation of industrial estates which benefited from the nearby major road system of the M74,the M8 and M73.
